title: Java script
content: I get error message from a game I play on Facebook that freezes my game & I have to refresh it. Message says to check my browser for java script. I really don't understand the message lol. Hope someone can answer my question. The game is Bingo Story and I have to say I get a lot of freezes. Y'all should teach their developers how things are done to fix freezing. Thanks
creator: Psychrn1102

title: All add-ons disappear after changing History preferences
content:
I wanted to change my History preferences to "Firefox will never remember history." After I select that, it prompts me to restart Firefox and I do. But when it boots back up, none of my add-ons are visible on the toolbar. I tried to restore customization settings back to default and uninstalled and reinstalled all of the add-ons but none of that worked. They all come back and function as soon I change the History preferences back to "Firefox will remember history."

My question is, is this normal Firefox behavior or is this a bug? If it's normal and I'm missing and obvious detail, please let me know.
creator: ertasog

title: Why gmail functions stopped working.
content: gmail functions like archive and many clicks has stopped working which is very annoying. Have to start chrome to do the work. Using firefox latest version on Linux. Any one else facing this ?

creator: startrails01

title: Newest versions of fire-fox unresponsive
content:
Upon installation of the newest versions (v83) of Firefox, Firefox became unresponsive: Unable to click weblinks, scroll, or even click on GUI menu bar options. Restarting in Safe Mode, refreshing, and uninstall/re-install of Firefox failed to solve these issues. Additional troubleshooting involved disabling accessibility, disabling DNS prefetch, adjusting memory cache, disabling network proxy, and etc. as put forth in various forum threads.

Only successful solution was to roll back to version 79 (Last known good version.)

I run Firefox, Firefox Nightly, and Firefox Developer Edition. This allows me to update one interface at a time, while retaining at least one active known good interface in reserve.
creator: MIddKnight

creator: aarich

title: Add-ons Compatibility Information
content:
I hope this is appropriate here. If not, please direct me to where it is.

As new releases of Firefox (and Thunderbird too) come out, a constant question for me is whether the add-ons that are important to me (I use a lot) will be compatible with the new release. It would help if

(1) The Add-Ons web site always allowed me to specify release and OS. Sometimes that is allowed, sometimes not.

(2) The Add-Ons web site allowed me to specify a release before which I don't want to see add-ons listed.

(3) The Extensions page in Firefox allowed me to ask which of my extensions (enabled and/or disabled) are supported/not supported in a specified future release.

(4) When Firefox wants to install a new release, it reported on extensions that would become incompatible and always asked my permission to go ahead.

It probably would not be necessary to do all of these things, but I included them all because I don't know which are the most practical.
creator: rfajman

title: Firefox 82.0 too slow
content: Page loading in Firefox 82.0 is way too slow, including on your own site, mozilla.org. It was even worse till I got Norton Security Suite to fix their problem, but it is still way too slow. Please fix asap.

title: Ctrl-T no longer opens new tab
content:
Since last update several keyboard shortcuts no longer work. I find them easier than using a mouse often. Two that are most annoying at not working is Ctrl-T to open a new tab Ctrl-C to copy. That now opens developer tools This all started with last update. Does anyone know how I can restore those keyboard shortcuts?

Anyone have any idea who would make a common keyboard shortcut like the one for copy do something different. Do these people not use computers?
creator: andrewdavidsgames

title: Firefox Browser Window shakes horizontally, uncontrollably, when I click on links in websites.
content: My Firefox for MAC 78.4.0esr (64-bit) Browser Window shakes horizontally, uncontrollably, when I click on links in websites. This began just before the last update, and happens more frequently than not, forcing me to abandon the application because I can't close the shaking window. I can't see a specific pattern to which links will cause this to happen, but if I restart Firefox and try the same link, it will repeat the error. My device is a MacBook Pro (15-inch, 2.53GHz, Mid 2009), OSX El Capitan V 10.11.6, 2.53 GHz Intel Core 2 Duo, 4 GB 1067 MHz DDR3, NVIDIA GeForce 9400M 256 MB. This error does not occur in Safari. Firefox is my preferred browser.
creator: stevekinney2@aol.com
